page.title: 13MINING
page.content: IN OUR AREA THERE ARE SEVERAL MINES, THEIR NAMES ARE MOSLEY COMMON,{ASTLEY {GREEN,}GIN PIT, CLEWORTH HALL AND LAST OF ALL HIGHER FOLD PIT. ALSO THERE HAVE BEEN RECENT DEVELOPMENTS FOR AN{OPEN-CAST}MINE IN THE AREA OF MORT LANE. THE MINE AT HIGHER GREEN LANE IS THE ONLY MINE OUT OF THE FOUR, THAT IS STILL VISIBLE IN{1985.}IT IS NOT USED FOR MINING ANY MORE BUT IS BEING TRANSFORMED INTO A{MUSEUM.}THE SLAGHEAPS AROUND IT ARE BEING CHANGED INTO A{9 HOLE GOLF COURSE.}ASTLEY GREEN PIT WAS OPENED IN{1912}AND CLOSED IN{1972.}THE HORSE POWER OF THE ENGINE WAS 3 000. THE SPAN OF THE WHEEL IS 27 FEET. THERE ARE SEVENTY TO EIGHTY MEMBERS OF THE{RESTORATION CLUB BUT ONLY TWENTY OF THEM DO THE ACTIVE WORK.
